explanation: Agent A's report is correct. The code calls memcmp(hdr->value, "close", 5) to test whether the existing Connection header equals the string "close". The literal "close" is a null-terminated string and hdr->value is treated as a header string here; using memcmp to compare string contents (even when passing a length that omits the terminating NUL) is precisely what MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 forbids. Therefore this use of memcmp violates Rule 21.14. (Note: other memcmp uses in the file that compare fixed-sized binary buffers with explicit sizes may be acceptable; the specific memcmp against "close" is the violation.)
